meanings.definition: The process of releasing strong emotions through a particular activity or experience.
meanings.sent1: Drawing can be a catharsis for me when I feel upset.
meanings.sent2: After watching a sad movie, crying can provide catharsis.
meanings.sent3: Laughing uncontrollably at a comedy show was a catharsis for my stress.
meanings.sent4: Screaming into the ocean, I felt a catharsis as if my worries were washed away.
meanings.sent5: Running in the rain felt like a catharsis, cleansing my mind of negative thoughts.

meanings.definition: A purging or cleansing of emotions.
meanings.sent1: Writing in my journal is a catharsis that helps me let go of pent-up feelings.
meanings.sent2: Talking to a friend can sometimes provide the catharsis I need to feel better.
meanings.sent3: Dancing wildly in my room was a catharsis that left me feeling refreshed.
meanings.sent4: Singing at the top of my lungs gave me a catharsis, releasing all my inner turmoil.
meanings.sent5: Hiking in nature acted as a catharsis, clearing my mind of any lingering negativity.
